description: This omelet is fluffier and lighter than the classic It uses Auguste Escoffier’s technique: whipping the egg whites and then gently folding in the yolks A small amount of heavy cream enriches the omelet, making it a good candidate for a final sprinkle of powdered sugar – or a jam filling
title: Omelet Mousseline
text:
This omelet is fluffier and lighter than the classic. It uses Auguste Escoffier’s technique: whipping the egg whites and then gently folding in the yolks. A small amount of heavy cream enriches the omelet, making it a good candidate for a final sprinkle of powdered sugar – or a jam filling. Served sweet or savory, it’s a decadent yet ethereal dish that truly melts in the mouth. This recipe is part of The New Essentials of French Cooking, a guide to definitive dishes every modern cook should master. Buy the book.
Learn: How to Cook Eggs
Learn: How to Make an Omelet
